title: How do authors come up with math questions for their textbooks? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on what kind of Mathematics. There are many problem generators so that we don't have to put as much work into it as one would think. Though this is needed as much anymore. In theory, the majority of the time you would start with the answer. An example: (x,y)=(5,6) ax+by=s cx+dy=t Choose some numbers for a,b,c and d 10(5)-9(6) = s 3(5)+7(6) = t s=-4 t=57 Knowing the answer gives us 10x-9y=-4 3x+7y=57
Elementary problems to reinforce the lesson. Compound problems incorporating the new knowledge with previously taught knowledge. Classical problems of historical significance.
